direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, I didn't call you here at such an hour to make accusations, I just want to explore the possibilities. Now, I have three questions; Is the man a foreign agent? Or, have we suddenly found that our methods of gathering data are grossly inefficient? Or, thirdly, have the man's files been destroyed? Now, I'd like some answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gardiner is not a foreign agent, there are now sixteen countries investigating the man. We can rule that out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well... Can we rule out inefficiency...? There is silence in the room. A couple of looks, but silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. What about question three? Is it possible to erase all traces of a man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Highly unlikely, sir... In fact, the boys around the Bureau feel that the only person capable of pulling it off would be an ex F.B.I. man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that's entirely true, Grover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do the boys around Intelligence think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. President... They don't quite know what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, needless to say, there is going to be a full Congressional investigation of your respective operations. (goes to door) Good night. The President leaves the Oval Office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve and Chance walk down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel so close to you, so safe with you, Chauncey... (stops at her bedroom door) ... And Benjamin understands that, dearest... He understands and accepts my feelings for you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Eve. Ben is very wise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Come in, Chauncey - please come in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Chance enters, Eve closes the door behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve turns on a soft lamp, Chance goes directly to her TV, turns it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can sense that you've been through a lot, Chauncey. But one day, when you feel like it, you'll tell me all about your life... (Chance watches an old movie) ... But, even if you tell me nothing, even if it's too painful for you to reveal your past... As she talks, Chance watches a love scene on TV. The hero gives his lady a passionate kiss and embrace. The scene seems to 'sink into' Chance's mind. He abruptly turns, takes Eve into his arms and kisses her full on the mouth. Just as abruptly, he turns away and changes channels on TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Chauncey... I do love you so much! She takes Chance in her arms, kisses him wildly. They fall to her bed in an embrace. As she holds him, kisses him, runs her hands over his body, Chance watches television, neither resists nor responds to Eve's caresses. Suddenly she stops, lets her head fall on Chance's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... You don't want me, Chauncey... You don't feel anything for me... Nothing at all... Chance sits up on the bed, then, feeling her sadness, gently strokes her hair as he looks at TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't excite you at all... I don't know what you want... I don't know what you like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To watch...? To watch me...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I like to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Is that all you want...? (a hesitation) ... To watch me...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It's very good, Eve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... But I've never done... (another hesitation) ... You mean...? When... When... When I do it? ... When I touch myself...? Eve slowly gets up from the bed, nervously paces the bedroom as Chance watches TV. She makes a decision, moves to Chance, kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Chauncey... She steps back, slips off her dress. She does not undress any further, instead, leans close to Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of those little things you don't know about me yet, darling - I'm a little shy. She smiles, gets in bed and pulls the covers over herself. Chance divides his attention between Eve and the TV, watching both with an equal detachment. Eve begins to respond to her own touch, finds a heretofore undiscovered pleasure with her own body. Chance changes the channel as she reaches orgasm. As Eve's body trembles, Chance yawns, gets up from the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Eve. A low purr is heard from Eve as Chance leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allenby, Constance and Teresa are readying a transfusion for Rand. There is a feeling of urgency as they work. Rand, very weak, strains to speak to Allenby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more, Robert... No more needles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not good, Ben - I'm sure you can feel it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, Robert... But, strangely enough, I don't feel too bad about now... I feel all right... I guess it's easier... knowing Chauncey is here... to take care of things... Teresa is about to swab Rand's arm with alcohol but he pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't want any of that... Please... please, just get me Mr. Gardiner, Teresa - please... he'll head it up... Teresa looks to Allenby, he nods to her. Teresa puts the cotton down, leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sits on the side of the bed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A light snow is failing. Eve is in a fur coat, holds a steaming cup of coffee. Chance stands next to her, an umbrella in one hand. He holds his other arm out, catching the snowflakes as they fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And I feel so free now, Chauncey. Until I met you, I never felt acknowledged by a man... (Chance gazes out at the falling snow) ... I always had the feeling that I was just a vessel for a man, someone that he could take hold of, pierce, and pollute. I was merely an aspect of somebody's lovemaking. Do you know what I mean? Chance turns to her, says nothing, presses the cold snowflakes to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dearest, you uncoil my wants; desire flows within me, and when you watch me my passion dissolves it. You set me free. I reveal myself to myself and I am drenched and purged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's very interesting, Eve. Teresa appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Gardiner. Mr. Rand would like to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I would like to see Ben. Chance gives Eve a warm smile, then follows Teresa into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allenby, with nothing more he can do to prolong Rand's life, sits on the bed close to him, grips his hand tightly. Teresa shows Chance into the room and Allenby motions to the nurses to leave. As they do, Chance, once again breathing the oxygen with a smile, goes to Rand's bedside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Chauncey... Chauncey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ben - are you going to die now? Allenby winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I'm about to surrender the Horn of Plenty for the Horn of Gabriel, my boy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me feel the strength in your hand, Chauncey... Let me feel your strength... (holds Chance's hand) Yes, that's good... I hope, Chauncey - I hope that you'll stay with Eve... Take care of her, watch over her, she's a delicate flower, Chauncey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A flower...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She cares for you and she needs your help, Chauncey... there's much to be looked after...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I would like to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I've worked very hard and enjoyed my life... I've known success... and I've felt love... My associates, Chauncey - I've talked with them about you... They're eager to meet you... very eager to meet you... I'm very fond of you, Chauncey... And I understand Eve... Tell her that... tell her I'm madly in love with her... Rand slumps down, dead. Allenby checks his pulse, turns to Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He's gone, Chauncey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Robert. I have seen it before. It happens to old people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I suppose that's true. Chance reaches out, uncovers Rand's face, gently touches the man's forehead, feels the coldness. Allenby eyes him as Chance stays with Rand for a moment, then replaces the sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you be leaving now, Robert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a day or two, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve is going to stay. The house will not be closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... You've become quite a close friend of Eve's - haven't you Mr... (a beat) ... Chance...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I love Eve very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see... (another beat) ... And you are really a gardener, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Robert - I am. (a smile at Allenby) I'll go tell Eve about Ben now, Robert. Chance leaves the bedroom. Allenby watches him go, then sits back in a chair, his head spinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cloudy, cold day patches of snow are on the ground. The Rand servants are lined up in front of the mansion, listen to funeral services for Rand on a pair of loudspeakers. PAN AROUND, reveal the services being held on a hill overlooking the mansion. Fifty mourners are gathered around the Rand family mausoleum. Chance stands with Eve and Allenby. The President of the United States stands before a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Millions of people across the world have heard of the passing of Benjamin Rand; but, unfortunately, only relatively few will feel the pain and sadness at such a loss. To most, Benjamin Rand was a legend; to those of us gathered here today, Benjamin was a beloved friend. My personal association with Benjamin dates back many years, and my memories of our friendship will stay with me forever. As the President speaks, Chance turns and walks away. Eve and Allenby watch as he goes into the trees surrounding the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I initially came in contact with the Rand name in 1943. 1 was a young lieutenant in the Air Corps, a navigator flying missions over Europe. That plane that I learned to know so well was manufactured by the Rand Aeronautics Corporation. (a beat) Benjamin Rand was an industrial giant, known to be powerful and uncompromising, and yet, on a personal level, we have all felt his warmth and humor... (a beat) ... I would like to share with you a few quotes, and a few feelings from our dear friend. (holds up paper, reads) ... 'I do not regret having political differences with men that I respect; I do regret, however, that our philosophies kept us apart.' ... 'I have no use for those on welfare, no patience whatsoever... But, if I am to be honest with myself, I must admit that they have no use for me, either.' ... 'I was born into a position of extreme wealth, I have spent many sleepless nights thinking about extreme poverty -  I do not know the feelings of being poor, and that is not to know the feelings of the majority of people in this world. For a man in my position, that is inexcusable.' 'Life is a state of mind.' ... 'When I was a boy, I was told that the Lord fashioned us from his own image. That's when I decided to manufacture mirrors.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah auditorium with row upon row of empty seats. Huddled together at one end of the hall are six important businessmen, speaking in hushed tones. JAMES DUDLEY, a powerful industrialist, speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what do we know of the man? Nothing! We have no inkling of his past!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a corporation chairman, joins in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Correct, and that is an asset. A man's past can cripple him, his background turns into a swamp and invites scrutiny. Another executive, PETER CALDWELL, agrees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To this time, he hasn't said anything that could be used against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a Texas oil millionaire;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm certainly open to the thought - it would be sheer lunacy to support the President for another term.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one will go along with that... Look at the facts, gentlemen, the response from his appearance on 'This Evening' was overwhelming; he has excited and awakened the people of this country at a time of despair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a banker;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's personable, elusive, yet seemingly honest. He's riding a crest of popularity that builds with every statement. As far as his thinking goes, he appears to be one of us. I firmly believe, gentlemen, that he is our only chance - Mr. Chauncey Gardiner!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance, his umbrella under his arm, walks through the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The services are over. Eve, Allenby talk with the President and the First Lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was very moving, Bobby - thank you so much...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all going to miss him, Eve... (glances around) ... Where's Mr. Gardiner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He walked off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chauncey is so sensitive... He was overcome with grief...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can certainly understand that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course... I'm so sorry for you, Eve...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Nancy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you soon. The President and First Lady head toward their limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance walks deeper into the woods, absorbed in the greenery. He stops by a tree, brushes some snow from a branch, moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The majority of mourners have left. Eve and Allenby walk slowly to the RAND 1 limousine, look around for Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Do you think we should look for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so, he should be along soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish he were here... Eve keeps looking as they walk to the limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance happens on a tree with a cracked limb, hanging to the ground. He stops, inspects the break, runs his fingers along the split in the bark. He looks to the ground, notices that an end of the limb has fallen on a seedling, bending it double. Chance pulls the limb away, then kneels beside the seedling. He removes an expensive paid of suede gloves, and, with gentle fingers, brushes the dirt and snow away from the seedling. Chance glances up to the remaining limbs of the larger tree which could fall and threaten the emerging tree. He unfolds his umbrella, places it over the seedling in a way to give it protection, yet to still allow it to receive light from the winter sun. Chance stands, puts his gloves back on and continues his walk, disappearing into a remote section of the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeffrey stands holding the door for Eve and Allenby, all the other cars have gone. Eve is worried, gets into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance walks through the woods, his pace faster than before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The limousine still waits for Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eve is deeply concerned for Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to find him, Robert - he could be lost, something may have happened, we can't leave him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really care for him, don't you, Eve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do - we do - both of us, Ben and I feel so much for Chauncey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we'd better go look for him. (he taps on the glass partition) David! David starts up the limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance walks with determination through the woods.
direction.name: direction
